boat.name: Charles Henry Ashley
boat.full_description:
'Charles Henry Ashley' was in service at Cemaes, Anglesey 1907 - 1932, then in storage at Cemlyn in ownership of Captain Hewitt.

She was sold by auction for £600 to Alec Roberton and took to the water in the 1970s after some renovation and motorisation by Alec helped by a group of enthusiasts.

In the late 1990s she was taken ashore at Dulas Bay, suffered slight hull damage, recovered, and was taken to a caravan park where she was put on display. When the caravan park was sold she could have been burnt but the Amlwch Heritage Trust secured her future, transferring her to Amlwch and then to Cemaes in 2000.

In 2006 a new team and £2,500 from a Wales Co-op grant, found much rotten wood and moved her to Bethel to be placed under cover.

Once more funds were raised, in 2007 she was awarded a Heritage Lottery Grant with the restoration completed by Classic Sailboats in 2008.

In April 2009 Charles Henry Ashley returned to Cemaes and is moored in the harbour.
boat.short_description: RNLI Watson type lifeboat for Cemaes, Anglesey,  crewed by Coxswain, 2nd Coxswain, Bowman and 12 Oarsmen.
